definitions.definition: To fasten, to join to (literally and figuratively).
definitions.example: An officer is attached to a certain regiment, company, or ship.

definitions.definition: To come into legal operation in connection with anything; to vest.
To win the heart of; to connect by ties of love or self-interest; to attract; to fasten or bind by moral influence; with to.
definitions.example: attached to a friend; attaching others to us by wealth or flattery

definitions.definition: To connect, in a figurative sense; to ascribe or attribute; to affix; with to.
definitions.example: to attach great importance to a particular circumstance

definitions.definition: To take, seize, or lay hold of.

definitions.example: I'm very attached to my pets.

definitions.definition: In a romantic or sexual relationship.
definitions.example: As far as I know, he isn't attached, so I'm going to invite him out on a date.

definitions.definition: Broadly joined to a stem or stipe, but not decurrent.
definitions.example: In this group of mushrooms, the attachment of the gills to the stipe ranges from attached to almost decurrent.

definitions.definition: Of a residential building, sharing walls with similar buildings on two, usually opposite, sides.
